document.title: Florida Department of Education - Student Performance Standards

41CA5BB16634493489F7891AAB514374.description: Perform email organization and cleanup (e.g., trash, flags, create folders).

C1CBB062830B4F8D95115C6C7E780368.description: Identify the appropriate use of email and demonstrate related email etiquette.

48C5FAD3D2C543B492C9B89533DB8A26.description: Use the Internet to perform email activities (i.e., web-based email).

28780D1581584278B710A7AC0D72DEBF.description: Reply to and forward an email message to one or more addressees

E21112405CCC4203AFBB935844AC06A9.description: Attach a file to an email message.

6EBE773B4A244A569FB57A71CD908996.description: Explain the format of an email address (i.e., user name, @ symbol, domain).

EC3D34BBFFB042DC926EB3904C3EF1FB.description: Identify components of an email message.

8148A1C4C29C4BBDA2110644F80DD6A3.description: Define “email “and describe the functions and advantages as a form of communication.

155F77B01A7141F187E1B76EA7EFCC42.description: Demonstrate appropriate use of email.  The student will be able to:

B479F29B7E254B9E918CD8D424AC2F29.description: Create a multimedia presentation that incorporates edited video, animation, music and/or narration, and that applies principles of good design, smooth transitions and effective message delivery.

9EF8173B13A44CFB9E44F2A7F6A90D83.description: Use video-editing software to produce a slide show or movie.

C45F478C97B446D5AB761EFF73E486AF.description: Use a portable digital video device (e.g., mobile phone, flip camera) or similar online tools  to shoot video files, and transfer them to a computer.

8CAE9F0D07F44B28B6655CD52EF3920D.description: Create a progressive slide presentation using graphical design/layout template features (e.g., SmartArt) and animated transitions.

F4409CD2F91A40D988FA8F2FEAB30E89.description: Save and export a digital photograph in a format that provides the best image quality and  file size for Internet use.

6EE61EB9654A464A93AFE25D8955E4E4.description: Modify shapes and colors in a graphical image.

694588C3AA8C4CC790128D4DB182F8B9.description: Create images with effects using different tools, brushes, adjustments and filters available in graphics software.

A5B3CADD8A054ABF9E125579C49A78FA.description: Define terms related to the creation and display of graphical images (e.g., raster, vector, transparency, opacity, cropping, lasso, magic wand, marquee, canvas size, flattened, blur, dodge, sharpen, staking order, free transform, lossless, adjustments, move, clone, zoom, layers,      filter, distort)

09C3B67168C14E7A9B3F252A325C92E6.description: Identify image file formats for photos and graphical art (e.g., TIFF, BMP, PSD, EPS, JPEG, GIF, PNG), and specify which formats are supported on the web.

AB6DE5D0D26F4D409DDA661A364AD101.description: Compare and contrast vector and raster images.

A794DDEA8EDD4D0F800C735DF7F9BE79.description: Describe graphics software and the ways it can be used.

AAEEAAA7636F4541BF9295217B0A3D34.description: Demonstrate proficiency in using graphics software.  The student will be able to:

04F00D08EE0B4BFBA9BFDC2F0D743E10.description: Modify a presentation’s setup to repeat (i.e., loop) the presentation continuously.

87FE461B1F9B4FC5B896485897E31C24.description: Produce a presentation that includes text, graphics and images, and present it.

2849BD0886BA48BC926B0BC2D42D238F.description: Modify the sequence of slides in a presentation.

2A563834DE2A41829EF3E621655505CA.description: Insert and/or modify sound settings and timing in a presentation.

1A78EB30035B4566BDB5CC0B4D8C5B9C.description: Modify slide transitions in a presentation to include animation.

6FFB110B545B455993A3F9CCEBFDD391.description: Insert new or duplicate slides in a presentation.

BF97821483DE413C889C13294F8061AC.description: Insert and format images/graphics in presentation slides.

9089731471FF41808FFDA1E6F95FAC02.description: Add slide numbers and/or date and time codes to presentation slides.

FFFD129F24B7440ABC20032007F40929.description: Add and format titles, subtitles and talking points in presentation slides.

7F127DA2BB814684905190FF01B889BF.description: Create and/or modify a “slide master” or template to apply a consistent appearance to a presentation.

B1DCBB7DC2FC4589B022E3193BE4110D.description: Describe presentation software and the ways it can be used.

03F4ADED21C64A459F4BAD60DCC4C896.description: Demonstrate proficiency in using presentation software.  The student will be able to:

CFFB4E8A13E14893ABFA4E087B5BA146.description: Revise a document using editing tools (e.g. Track Changes) in a word processor, and accept or reject changes as appropriate.

26C6FFA2DF5448C282DC2F54F519F067.description: Add comments to a document when reviewing and/or editing content.

80510977B04C4A908109D648BCFF9AF3.description: Use the translation tool in a word processor to translate text in a document from English into another language, and vice versa.

C7E274B9483E4B2CB980EC2EA07A99B7.description: Define “collaboration” and explain ways that users can collaborate on word-processing documents, including installed software vs. cloud-based software, real-time collaboration, auto save, sharing tools, revision history.

8344A322631E42C39F8BC36A598C1B35.description: Convert a body of text into a table structure in a document to make content easier to read and understand.

16F4DD325B1D4C8899F0FE96AD6B4782.description: Create a table in a word-processing document, and enter and move data in the table.

A152D5A592E64CCAB3BB4660EBD4F951.description: Create a simple brochure and/or flyer using a template

617360C9557E4F7FBF1CD585EBA30C5E.description: Format numbered and bulleted lists to produce multi-level outline in a document.

8EF06726289E42A2A6AB3A97F41C0230.description: Apply simple numbered and bulleted lists in a document to make content easier to read and understand.

3348E36E88E64911BA0BF2287CDAF6FF.description: Apply a column layout to text in a document as appropriate for the content (e.g., article, newsletter).

E820A84A967D43B596E4F79A5C437627.description: Use word-processor drawing tools to create a visual representation of information (e.g. SmartArt), such as diagram, flow chart.

0BC55648B3A64DA48807AD12183189BF.description: Use word-processing drawing tools to create pre-formatted shapes that enhance a document’s content.

8D79116C141C4DF69E424BD70505CEC3.description: Position an image relative to text in a document, using various  text-wrapping options (inline, square, tight).

9CF37FDDC9B44D0793BD1D5D95621215.description: Insert and modify sizing of images in a word-processing document.

237D95C099FF491C8412A5F29AEBB211.description: Use spell check, grammar check, thesaurus, and find & replace to edit a document.

4167C248D4B04034B86B08BCB59F567B.description: Use word processor tools to determine the number of pages, words and characters in a document.

315DB5353475492FAF1EE4B8CCF19E00.description: Insert a current date and time stamp into a document.

B21817D93F9645C3B3342AE9B60F7799.description: Create source citations and/or a bibliography in a document.

646646079C6545698E582AE0FC46AEA2.description: Insert page breaks in a document.

35A7D795B45041F78248B379AC59455B.description: Create a table of contents using auto-generation tools and techniques in a word processor.

E5579FB0BE4C4B12AE042B08C32508EA.description: Format a document using multi-level heading styles to enable an outline view (e.g. document map, navigation pane) in a word processor.

3A5F861F36B5475993138A7E93819210.description: Format text using styles and font tools in a word processor.

2A9C676D7A4C479F98AE653C78FA89A1.description: Define the term “format” as it relates to word processing.

7D4EA0DDB5EC4035A1DC4D3EFED22AAE.description: Modify document view settings to display close-up, single and multiple pages.

CCA308AF4A1B4825AE8CE268AD35A925.description: Copy, paste and move text among multiple documents using mouse, menu and keyboard techniques.

F1E649A2311B4B14A71DECA880C1B26A.description: Copy, paste and move text within a document using mouse, menu and keyboard techniques.

43B9CA71EF9E44938D9A471CD0FF6190.description: Explain printing options in a word processor, including shrink-to-fit, 2-sided printing, and document orientation.

211C98308A724C6AAAECADDC3C1B24E4.description: Format the page setup of a document, including margins, line spacing, indents, headers vs. footers, orientation.

E786EDA098624C919F00213F707A4A4E.description: Identify common keyboard shortcuts used in word processors, and explain the benefits of using shortcuts.

A2975CFFCF2744169E2F6B05081E809B.description: List and describe common word processor interface tools and features.

90D6277EC27B40408026AFBCAEBCBC87.description: Define the term “cloud computing,” and explain benefits of creating and storing word-processing documents online.

0E95D87247724160B8FEA18E96028BB3.description: Describe the general functions of word-processing software, including benefits for document creation, commonly used word-processing applications.

279386790C5C46479AEF551CA7D95072.description: Demonstrate proficiency in using word processing software. The student will be able to:

B346ADF1ECDA4F3F80DE31765633BC44.description: Properly cite Internet sources used to obtain information for a research project.

5E08D5017D014BED9415597D226D864A.description: Properly cite Internet sources used to obtain information for a research project.

712DCC7B9A4F47CD9493167B3A2010A6.description: Incorporate results from Internet searches into a research project (e.g., report, summary).

A3C71EE388CF4013ACAAF799B972CB98.description: Identify and apply copyright and fair use guidelines, and explain plagiarism as an ethical and legal violation.

AFB9CB7290E648B2BF9E3127EC43DEAC.description: Evaluate online information for relevance, credibility and quality using basic guidelines and indicators (e.g. authority, affiliation, purpose, bias, date).

B35E3416B7AA46E198127AB861375488.description: Compare and contrast the roles of web servers and web browsers.

1657D0AF823F4DF4AFCF70F29E237C58.description: Demonstrate proficiency using various web tools (e.g., downloading of files, transfer of files, telnet, PDF).

6CE09D6ABF4F464A95AA788D63AC51A1.description: Demonstrate proficiency using search engines, including Boolean search techniques.

1823D8046FE64B36BFD1F9E3E3E1F697.description: Compare and contrast the types of Internet domains (e.g., .com, .org, .edu, .gov, .net, .mil).

CC54492F1EA24E2EA6708B71B4C38DAB.description: Define Universal Resource Locators (URLs) and associated protocols (e.g., http, ftp, telnet, mailto).

3F1D095084C14B3589797B00C4D17BDD.description: Identify and use web terminology (WWW, Web Browser, Internet, Web Server,  Web Page, Address Bar, Hyperlinks, Navigation Buttons, Search Bar, Bookmarks/Favorites, Tab, Downloading, Plug-ins, Social Media Plug-ins).

A283049D67D24855A7737DBFF04C176D.description: Demonstrate proficiency using the Internet to locate information. The student will be able to:

B6B9C547C284496789B34D0A88D0207F.description: Adhere to Acceptable Use Policies when accessing the Internet.

CB4F36D222A64F81956FFCE08E94D62C.description: Identify security issues related to mobile phones, including personal information compromised if a phone is lost or stolen.

FA6483F22BE540F586DF58806982EDF0.description: Practice cyber safety techniques to protect your computer system when using Internet searches, email and social network websites.

1624738C237D4611AEF7FDCA70E207E6.description: Perform an antivirus scan on a computer system to check for viruses and malware.

AC3308079D0544AE988D3C1C2CEE6C3E.description: Describe common threats used to spread malware and viruses, including phishing, pharming, Trojans, spyware, malicious sites, “free” downloads.

B03A582E440F4206991A41EAEC48CC5E.description: Distinguish between viruses and malware and discuss their impact on personal privacy and computer operation.

A3C2C9510303450B887DDBC3549DDB83.description: Compare and contrast rules for copyright and fair use, especially in relation to using online resources for school and educational purposes.

218AC1CBD645435A8C0AE9ED00F8443A.description: Discuss issues related to downloading music or videos from the Internet, including unethical vs. illegal actions.

D1D5280EB51241F093D5F1D7ED1F1F60.description: Describe risks associated with online gaming, and identify ways to reduce these risks.

2524194883FD48839545C2A13965764E.description: Describe risks associated with sexting (including legal issues, social consequences), and  discuss methods for response, reporting, and prevention.

A8223259989F43B2AE3406DB6918C8AB.description: Describe cyberbullying, its impact on perpetrators and victims and ways to respond.

81F3BDC2C06B4343AD75691B73D7BA66.description: Practice cyber safety techniques to protect your personal information when using internet searches,  email, chat rooms, and social network websites.

CA013D9D1EFF4D24928B189118282177.description: Define “privacy” and relate it to the term “digital footprint”.

3F69DA31AD514CEE9823201AB087163E.description: Describe risks associated with social networking sites (e.g., FaceBook, Snapchat, Instagram, Twitter) and ways to reduce these risks.

DCAF1FCD7D5047EA8384D77AC49B13B8.description: Demonstrate an understanding of Internet safety and ethics.  The student will be able to:

E8FB3C9857574BF2A6E1825E721360DB.description: Demonstrate proficiency in using gadgets, icons, and taskbars and other pre-loaded operating system programs. (e.g., calculator, text editor, clock, volume controls, adding icons and shortcuts to taskbar and shortcut menus).

73A546C9FD09413CAE62B6EBE699FF05.description: Be able to identify file types by extension (e.g., .doc, .txt, .wav, xls).

07E4781328C24939841C265A4E1BC9A8.description: Demonstrate proficiency with file management tasks (e.g., folder creation, file creation, backup, copy, delete, open, save).

DA524D869E7746D79A8B9C8BC5A210C1.description: Describe and use conventional file naming conventions.

11C21F1789D640FC891E0D709EAE5304.description: Compare and contrast various operating systems used in a computer and mobile devices (i.e., Windows, OS (Apple), UNIX, Android, iOS).

87D8245A29604C9086B2F1AC49B9A794.description: Demonstrate knowledge of different operating systems.  The student will be able to:

F02ECB6CDC124441A2B360DFE93E711B.description: Identify and know how to connect various storage devices (e.g., flash drive, external hard drive (SSD, network drive), memory card, discs, cloud).

BEC0217A5DB04B7D9C515662B19DCADF.description: Identify and know how to connect various computer output devices (e.g., monitor, printer, projector, speakers,            headphones) and describe their use.

82266CEFB8664617A04507D8A3FAC169.description: Identify and know how to connect various computer input devices (e.g., mouse, keyboard, phone, camera,                  scanner, microphone, game controller, stylus, barcode reader finger print scanner, GPS device, touch pad, graphics tablet) and describe their use.

AFC7CDFFF7054F9088E156986BD317C7.description: Identify the internal components of a computer (e.g., case, CPU, RAM, power  drive, supply, hard drive, motherboard, expansion cards, cabling).

0CBBBF7928FC41EB8F80EF53BDCB567E.description: Describe what defines a computer and ways a computer can be used.

35D95CF4B2DD4694A2B68A6187D11850.description: Identify computer components and their functions.  The student will be able to:
